answers.author: Pooja Varma
answers.text:
Hi Kathleen,
There are several documents on the Knowledge Network that describe partnerships and initiatives between the City and different types of community groups. Here are a few that should prove to be useful.  
City of Cincinnati- Neighborhood- narrative describes a decline in the environmental quality of several neighborhoods and how the city created the Neighborhood Enhancement Program in collaboration with the community and corporate sector to combat these problems. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/100174/Cincinnatis_Neighborhood_Enhancement_Program 
An article from PM magazine “Business Improvement Districts: Partnering Local Government and Business” 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/6186/Business_Improvement_Districts_Partnering_Local_Government_and_Business
The Neighborhood Partnership Program from the Village of Grayslake, IL provides a supplemental partnership program for residents and Community Associations to aid the City in mainlining a clean environment.  
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/12897/The_Neighborhood_Partnership_Program 
Beautification Initiatives Enhance Tourism – describes the experience of two Counties in Texas that have created Beautification Coalitions with citizens, businesses and government organizations to create a master plan and increase sense of ownership and responsibility. 
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/1810/Beautification_Initiatives_Enhance_Tourism 
I hope that is useful,
Pooja Varma
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
pvarma@icma.org

author: Kathleen Margoles
text: A decline in City revenues has decreased our resources for sidewalk cleaning and other services in the downtown area.  We want to engage the business owners in finding solutions to keeping the downtown area looking inviting.   The CRA covers the downtown area, the Chamber of Commerce is located downtown and the merchants have also organized a Downtown Cultural Alliance to promote events in the downtown area to attract visitors.  The City relationship with these three groups is not as strong as it could be but we are very interested in changing that dynamic.
title: Downtown Business Owner Engagement
